item.title: Policies
item.description: Evaluation: Your final grade will be comprised of the following: Preparation and participation 15% Programming assignments 40% Online presentation 10% Midterm exam 15% Research project 20% - paper (8%) - presentation (6%) - peer review (6%) Preparation and participation Students are expected to attend class prepared and to actively participate.

item.title: Components
item.description: Tidy Visualize Model Communicate Topics: Tidyverse Importing, cleaning/tidying data Subsetting Creating and transforming variables Preparing data for visualization and analysis Topics: Grammar of graphics ggplot2 Topics: Multiple regression and correlation The linear model The generalized linear model Model assessment Model specification Topics: RMarkdown knitr papaja xaringan git

item.title: Tools
item.description: R Github Slack R is the statistical programming language we will learn about in this class. You can download R here. We will interface with R using RStudio, a fully feautred IDE. RStudio is available to download here. Github is a web-based Git version control repository hosting service. It is mostly used for computer code (like Dropbox for nerds).
